quotes.author: William of Ockham
quotes.quote: Entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily.
quotes.meaning: When constructing theories, prefer the simplest explanation that accounts for all evidence.

quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes
quotes.quote: The life of man (in a state of nature) is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
quotes.meaning: Without social structures, human existence is chaotic and insecure.

quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne
quotes.quote: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes — most of which never happened.
quotes.meaning: Much of human suffering comes from imagined threats rather than real ones.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
quotes.meaning: Human folly seems boundless, surpassing even cosmic scale.

quotes.author: Nelson Mandela
quotes.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
quotes.meaning: Knowledge and learning empower transformation at individual and societal levels.

quotes.author: Victor Frankl
quotes.quote: Life is never made unbearable by circumstances, but only by lack of meaning and purpose.
quotes.meaning: Suffering becomes intolerable when we see no reason or goal in life.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
quotes.meaning: Adversity can foster resilience and growth.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
quotes.meaning: One’s inner character and potential matter more than past or future circumstances.

quotes.author: Buddha
quotes.quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
quotes.meaning: Self-effort and inner discipline are essential to spiritual or moral progress.

quotes.author: Buddha
quotes.quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.meaning: Our thoughts shape our character and destiny.

quotes.author: Sun Tzu
quotes.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
quotes.meaning: True mastery lies in achieving objectives without unnecessary conflict.

quotes.author: Heraclitus
quotes.quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice.
quotes.meaning: Reality is in constant flux; both the river and the person are always changing.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.meaning: Humility and wisdom demand more listening than speaking.

quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared; it is only to be understood.
quotes.meaning: Understanding through inquiry dispels fear.

quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.quote: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
quotes.meaning: Curiosity about the cosmos broadens perspective beyond oneself.

quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.quote: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.
quotes.meaning: Engagement through purposeful work anchors our sense of value.

quotes.author: Richard Feynman
quotes.quote: What I cannot create, I do not understand.
quotes.meaning: Deep comprehension is demonstrated through the ability to reconstruct or simulate phenomena.

quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein
quotes.quote: Everything is theoretically impossible until it is done.
quotes.meaning: Breakthroughs often overturn perceived limits of possibility.

quotes.author: Cecilia Payne-Gaposchkin
quotes.quote: The reward of the young scientist is the emotional thrill of being the first person in the history of the world to see something or to understand something.
quotes.meaning: Discovery brings intrinsic exhilaration at witnessing novelty.

quotes.author: David Eagleman
quotes.quote: What you learn from a life in science is the vastness of our ignorance.
quotes.meaning: Scientific progress chiefly reveals the depth of what we don’t yet know.
